DOC.brief_summary: The administration of agar jelly may increase the number of defecation and the volume of feces, and then may improve fecal condition in chronic constipated patients.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Agar Administration on Defecation and Fecal Condition in Chronic Constipated Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Each subject eats one cap of agar jelly shortly before having dinner every day for 4 weeks. At 0, 7th, 14th, 21th, and 28th day , the frequency of defecation and defecation condition is assessed.
DOC.criteria: subjects take laxatives. subjects underwent abdominal surgery.
